abstracts.cdata!:
This is a report presenting guidelines
            for structuring sectoral environmental assessments for the
            Energy Sector Technical Assistance Project in Colombia,
            which implements regulatory reforms and modifies the
            legislative framework to incorporate environmental concerns
            and constraints in the gas and energy sectors, and to
            attract private investment in infrastructure. This report
            analyzes Colombia's proposal for reforming its
            regulatory regime in environmental licensing against the
            backdrop of laws on environmental assessment existing in
            countries with comparable experiences. The proposed changes
            to Colombia's laws modify existing law by establishing
            1) an instrument of environmental policy corresponding to
            the environmental impact evaluation; 2) actions triggering
            environmental impact studies; 3) mechanisms to determine the
            reach/range of these studies and evaluation criteria as well
            as to identify their significance; and 4) mechanisms for
            public participation in government decisionmaking about
            investment projects. It also contains six sections
            presenting recommendations to strengthen national
            environmental policy, the program for environmental
            licensing, and the incorporation of environmental
            considerations in planning, operating, and maintaining
            infrastructure projects.
